channel.title: PSP + LCD screen
channel.description:
I hate small screens, and my PSP has one. So I was wondering: is a PSP capable of using a ~17" LCD screen?
Just an idea here: Break open a PSP, and remove the small screen. Then add a big screen, make a case that can hold both the screen and the hardware of a PSP, write a driver here and there and voila: A 17" e-book reader/PSP.
I know shit about software, and even less about hardware, so this might look like a stupid idea. But the result is something nice, I guess. I mean, it's not that much cpu/whatever consuming to fill a screen with white and black pixels, is it?

item.title: PSP + LCD screen
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Mopman:

No, not without modification. But you wouldn’t have to deal with any “compiled PSP firmware code”.

Well what do you think tells the GPU what the clip bounds are?

Read full topic

item.title: PSP + LCD screen
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Unhandled:

Yeah you would, the GPU won’t let you draw anything outside of 480x272.

No, not without modification. But you wouldn’t have to deal with any “compiled PSP firmware code”.

Read full topic

item.title: PSP + LCD screen
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Mopman:

You wouldn’t need to do that just to read a few ebooks

Yeah you would, the GPU won’t let you draw anything outside of 480x272. Plus the motherboard doesn’t have enough physical contacts to be able to adapt to a VGA port.
If you want to read ebooks, take a look at this: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_Kindle

Read full topic

item.title: PSP + LCD screen
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:17, topic:250893”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=331035.msg2588188#msg2588188 date=1229628175]
It really wouldn’t be as difficult a mod as people are making out, once the case was made. Like I said though, finding an LCD that large that dosen’t draw so much more power so as to make the battery life horrible may be a challenge.
[/quote]
Yeah and good luck modding every bit of compiled PSP firmware code to use your new resolution.[/quote]

You wouldn’t need to do that just to read a few ebooks

Read full topic

item.title: PSP + LCD screen
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:14, topic:250893”][quote author=the bank link=topic=331035.msg2587183#msg2587183 date=1229563975]
I have this image of you walking down the street with a massive computer monitor in your hand tied to the little psp in your pocket.
[/quote]

Hehe, that would be quite a sight.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F-N5MkmZtmM
How to put firmware on your psp, i.e, youtube, etc,.

Utterly irrelevant.

Seriously, a project like this would require a lot of skills, solder, and patience. The amount of work you would have to do completely outweighs any potential benefits.

Perhaps, yes. As far as I know a good e-book reader is about €400. But I’m more interested in the process of making it.[/quote]

Just get a little PPC with WM* on it. They always read e-books.

Read full topic

item.title: PSP + LCD screen
item.dc:creator: @Wrauld Wrauld
item.description:
@Wrauld wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:8, topic:250893”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=331035.msg2586229#msg2586229 date=1229533228]

I hate small screens, and my PSP has one.
[/quote]if you hate small screens, why did you buy a handheld

It was an impulse purchase. I had some spare cash, and it seemed nice. But then I found out I don’t like small screens and I can’t be assed to sell it.

With the PSP 2000 and newer, you can hook up your PSP to a television using the video-out port.

Just as a fun project, I want to mod it altogether.[/quote]
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=F-N5MkmZtmM
How to put firmware on your psp, i.e, youtube, etc,.

item.title: PSP + LCD screen
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Maybe you need to add a controller between the motherboard of the PSP and the screen, but compatibility in the way you mean won’t be a problem. What I’m worried about more, is that the PSP can’t handle a big resolution.

Also, what exactly did you try with your iPod video?

Mopman, that can be another problem. But how do those e-book readers work? Of course they are made for one thing, but merely drawing a bunch of pixels and powering a backlight isn’t that battery consuming, is it?

Read full topic
